This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are hidden beneath the thallus and produce spores for dispersal. Xanthoxerampellia hedwigiae plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
